message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about memory-based learning approaches to shallow parsing, which is a natural language processing task. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses feature selection techniques and system combination methods, which are common in machine learning and data mining, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the use of memory-based learning suggests the possibility of using neural networks, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions evaluating the approach on standard data sets, which is a common practice in information retrieval (cs.IR) and the use of system combination methods is also common in neural networks (cs.NE).
